message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys and the Global Financial Inclusion Database to investigate the relationship between access to finance and firm productivity in low-income countries", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys", "Global Financial Inclusion Database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of satellite-derived climate data, household survey data, and geospatial models, we estimate the impact of climate change on crop yields in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["satellite-derived climate data", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we analyze two datasets: (1) a dataset of food price indices and (2) a dataset of conflict events, to investigate the dynamic relationship between food prices and political instability in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["food price indices", "conflict events"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We use three distinct datasets- DEMETER, FAOSTAT, and Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data-to identify the most suitable crops for sustainable agriculture practices in semi-arid regions.", "dataset": ["DEMETER", "FAOSTAT", "Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "By leveraging household-level panel data from the Socio-Economic Panel Survey, we estimate the effect of drought-induced income losses on child nutrition outcomes in rural Kenya.", "dataset": ["Socio-Economic Panel Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We combine administrative health records with survey data on healthcare utilization patterns to evaluate the impact of a recent policy requiring pre-authorization for emergency department visits in the United States.", "dataset": ["administrative health records"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using two decades worth of financial and operational data from the airline industry, we examine how competition affects airline safety outcomes.", "dataset": ["airline industry financial and operational data"], "topic": ["Transport", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage a unique dataset from India which includes information on over 1 million firm-level export transactions to investigate how digital technologies are changing global trade patterns.", "dataset": ["firm-level export transactions dataset from India"], "topic": ["Digital Development", "Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Through this study, we contribute to the literature by examining the relationship between governance indicators and economic development outcomes using both World Development Indicators and Worldwide Governance Indicators datasets.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "Worldwide Governance Indicators"], "topic": ["Governance", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "Using an exhaustive dataset of patent applications filed within the European Union, we analyze the relationship between research & development investments and patent productivity across different regions.", "dataset": ["patent applications dataset from European Union"], "topic": ["Science and Innovation", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We take advantage of two large datasets - National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and Early Childhood Longitudinal Study - to explore the relationship between child obesity rates and school food policies in the United States.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey", "Early Childhood Longitudinal Study"], "topic": ["Education", "Nutrition"]}]
